results.definition: exercise designed to extend the limbs and muscles to their full extent
occupy a large, elongated area
examples: The park stretched beneath the train line

results.definition: corrupt, debase, or make impure by adding a foreign or inferior substance; often by replacing valuable ingredients with inferior ones
lie down comfortably
examples: To enjoy the picnic, we stretched out on the grass

results.definition: the act of physically reaching or thrusting out
extend or stretch out to a greater or the full length
examples: stretch out that piece of cloth

results.definition: increase in quantity or bulk by adding a cheaper substance
examples: stretch the soup by adding some more cream

results.definition: make long or longer by pulling and stretching
an unbroken period of time during which you do something
examples: he did a stretch in the federal penitentiary

results.definition: the capacity for being stretched
extend one's body or limbs
examples: Let's stretch for a minute--we've been sitting here for over 3 hours

results.definition: extend one's limbs or muscles, or the entire body
a large and unbroken expanse or distance
a straightaway section of a racetrack
become longer by being stretched and pulled
easily stretched
extend the scope or meaning of; often unduly
extension to or beyond the ordinary limit
examples: by no stretch of the imagination
beyond any stretch of his understanding

results.definition: having an elongated seating area
pull in opposite directions
examples: During the Inquisition, the torturers would stretch their victims on a rack
